intro: Cleistocalyx decussatus, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the summer months.
